sn55.23:1.2.pli: Atha kho mahānāmo sakko yena godhā sakko tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā godhaṃ sakkaṃ etadavoca:
sn55.23:1.2.eng: Then Mahānāma the Sakyan went up to Godhā the Sakyan, and said to him,

sn55.23:1.3.pli: “katihi tvaṃ, godhe, dhammehi samannāgataṃ sotāpannapuggalaṃ ājānāsi avinipātadhammaṃ niyataṃ sambodhiparāyaṇan”ti?
sn55.23:1.3.eng: “Godhā, how many things must a individual have for you to recognize them as a stream-enterer, not liable to be reborn in the underworld, destined for awakening?”

sn55.23:2.1.pli: “Tīhi khvāhaṃ, mahānāma, dhammehi samannāgataṃ sotāpannapuggalaṃ ājānāmi avinipātadhammaṃ niyataṃ sambodhiparāyaṇaṃ.
sn55.23:2.1.eng: “Mahānāma, an individual must have three things for me to recognize them as a stream-enterer.

sn55.23:2.3.pli: Idha, mahānāma, ariyasāvako buddhe aveccappasādena samannāgato hoti—
sn55.23:2.3.eng: It’s when a noble disciple has experiential confidence in the Buddha …

sn55.23:2.4.pli: itipi so bhagavā …pe… satthā devamanussānaṃ buddho bhagavāti.

sn55.23:2.7.pli: suppaṭipanno bhagavato sāvakasaṅgho …pe… anuttaraṃ puññakkhettaṃ lokassāti.

sn55.23:2.8.pli: Imehi khvāhaṃ, mahānāma, tīhi dhammehi samannāgataṃ sotāpannapuggalaṃ ājānāmi avinipātadhammaṃ niyataṃ sambodhiparāyaṇaṃ.
sn55.23:2.8.eng: When an individual has these three things I recognize them as a stream-enterer.

sn55.23:3.1.pli: Tvaṃ pana, mahānāma, katihi dhammehi samannāgataṃ sotāpannapuggalaṃ ājānāsi avinipātadhammaṃ niyataṃ sambodhiparāyaṇan”ti?
sn55.23:3.1.eng: But Mahānāma, how many things must an individual have for you to recognize them as a stream-enterer?”

sn55.23:3.2.pli: “Catūhi khvāhaṃ, godhe, dhammehi samannāgataṃ sotāpannapuggalaṃ ājānāmi avinipātadhammaṃ niyataṃ sambodhiparāyaṇaṃ.
sn55.23:3.2.eng: “Godhā, an individual must have four things for me to recognize them as a stream-enterer.

sn55.23:3.4.pli: Idha, godhe, ariyasāvako buddhe aveccappasādena samannāgato hoti—
sn55.23:3.4.eng: It’s when a noble disciple has experiential confidence in the Buddha …

sn55.23:3.5.pli: itipi so bhagavā …pe… satthā devamanussānaṃ buddho bhagavāti.

sn55.23:3.8.pli: ariyakantehi sīlehi samannāgato hoti akhaṇḍehi …pe… samādhisaṃvattanikehi.
sn55.23:3.8.eng: And they have the ethical conduct loved by the noble ones … leading to immersion.

sn55.23:3.9.pli: Imehi khvāhaṃ, godhe, catūhi dhammehi samannāgataṃ sotāpannapuggalaṃ ājānāmi avinipātadhammaṃ niyataṃ sambodhiparāyaṇan”ti.
sn55.23:3.9.eng: When an individual has these four things I recognize them as a stream-enterer.”

sn55.23:4.2.pli: Bhagavāva etaṃ jāneyya etehi dhammehi samannāgataṃ vā asamannāgataṃ vā”ti.
sn55.23:4.2.eng: Only the Buddha would know whether or not they have these things.”

sn55.23:4.3.pli: “Āyāma, godhe, yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkameyyāma; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocessāmā”ti.
sn55.23:4.3.eng: “Come, Godhā, let’s go to the Buddha and inform him about this.”

sn55.23:4.4.pli: Atha kho mahānāmo sakko godhā ca sakko yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkamiṃsu; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdiṃsu. Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho mahānāmo sakko bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
sn55.23:4.4.eng: Then Mahānāma and Godhā went to the Buddha, bowed, and sat down to one side. Mahānāma told the Buddha all that had happened, and then said:

sn55.23:5.1.pli: “Idhāhaṃ, bhante, yena godhā sakko tenupasaṅkamiṃ; upasaṅkamitvā godhaṃ sakkaṃ etadavocaṃ:

sn55.23:5.2.pli: ‘katihi tvaṃ, godhe, dhammehi samannāgataṃ sotāpannapuggalaṃ ājānāsi avinipātadhammaṃ niyataṃ sambodhiparāyaṇaṃ’?

sn55.23:5.3.pli: Evaṃ vutte, bhante, godhā sakko maṃ etadavoca—

sn55.23:6.1.pli: Tīhi khvāhaṃ, mahānāma, dhammehi samannāgataṃ sotāpannapuggalaṃ ājānāmi avinipātadhammaṃ niyataṃ sambodhiparāyaṇaṃ.

sn55.23:6.3.pli: Idha, mahānāma, ariyasāvako buddhe aveccappasādena samannāgato hoti—

sn55.23:6.4.pli: itipi so bhagavā …pe… satthā devamanussānaṃ buddho bhagavāti.

sn55.23:6.7.pli: suppaṭipanno bhagavato sāvakasaṅgho …pe… anuttaraṃ puññakkhettaṃ lokassāti.

sn55.23:6.8.pli: Imehi khvāhaṃ, mahānāma, tīhi dhammehi samannāgataṃ sotāpannapuggalaṃ ājānāmi avinipātadhammaṃ niyataṃ sambodhiparāyaṇaṃ.

sn55.23:6.9.pli: Tvaṃ pana, mahānāma, katamehi dhammehi samannāgataṃ sotāpannapuggalaṃ ājānāsi avinipātadhammaṃ niyataṃ sambodhiparāyaṇan’ti?

sn55.23:7.1.pli: Evaṃ vuttāhaṃ, bhante, godhaṃ sakkaṃ etadavocaṃ:

sn55.23:7.2.pli: ‘catūhi khvāhaṃ, godhe, dhammehi samannāgataṃ sotāpannapuggalaṃ ājānāmi avinipātadhammaṃ niyataṃ sambodhiparāyaṇaṃ.

sn55.23:7.4.pli: Idha, godhe, ariyasāvako buddhe aveccappasādena samannāgato hoti—

sn55.23:7.5.pli: itipi so bhagavā …pe… satthā devamanussānaṃ buddho bhagavāti.

sn55.23:7.8.pli: ariyakantehi sīlehi samannāgato hoti akhaṇḍehi …pe… samādhisaṃvattanikehi.

sn55.23:7.9.pli: Imehi khvāhaṃ, godhe, catūhi dhammehi samannāgataṃ sotāpannapuggalaṃ ājānāmi avinipātadhammaṃ niyataṃ sambodhiparāyaṇan’ti.

sn55.23:8.1.pli: Evaṃ vutte, bhante, godhā sakko maṃ etadavoca:

sn55.23:8.3.pli: Bhagavāva etaṃ jāneyya etehi dhammehi samannāgataṃ vā asamannāgataṃ vā’ti.

sn55.23:8.4.pli: Idha, bhante, kocideva dhammo samuppādo uppajjeyya, ekato assa bhagavā ekato bhikkhusaṅgho ca.
sn55.23:8.4.eng: “Sir, some issue regarding the teaching might come up. The Buddha might take one side, and the Saṅgha of monks the other.

sn55.23:8.6.pli: Evaṃ pasannaṃ maṃ, bhante, bhagavā dhāretu.
sn55.23:8.6.eng: May the Buddha remember me as having such confidence.

sn55.23:8.7.pli: Idha, bhante, kocideva dhammo samuppādo uppajjeyya, ekato assa bhagavā ekato bhikkhusaṅgho bhikkhunisaṅgho ca.
sn55.23:8.7.eng: Some issue regarding the teaching might come up. The Buddha might take one side, and the Saṅgha of monks and the Saṅgha of nuns the other. …

sn55.23:8.9.pli: Evaṃ pasannaṃ maṃ, bhante, bhagavā dhāretu.

sn55.23:8.10.pli: Idha, bhante, kocideva dhammo samuppādo uppajjeyya, ekato assa bhagavā ekato bhikkhusaṅgho bhikkhunisaṅgho ca upāsakā ca.
sn55.23:8.10.eng: The Buddha might take one side, and the Saṅgha of monks and the Saṅgha of nuns and the laymen the other. …

sn55.23:8.12.pli: Evaṃ pasannaṃ maṃ, bhante, bhagavā dhāretu.

sn55.23:8.13.pli: Idha, bhante, kocideva dhammo samuppādo uppajjeyya, ekato assa bhagavā ekato bhikkhusaṅgho bhikkhunisaṅgho upāsakā upāsikāyo ca.
sn55.23:8.13.eng: The Buddha might take one side, and the Saṅgha of monks and the Saṅgha of nuns and the laymen and the laywomen the other. …

sn55.23:8.15.pli: Evaṃ pasannaṃ maṃ, bhante, bhagavā dhāretu.

sn55.23:8.16.pli: Idha, bhante, kocideva dhammo samuppādo uppajjeyya, ekato assa bhagavā ekato bhikkhusaṅgho bhikkhunisaṅgho upāsakā upāsikāyo sadevako ca loko samārako sabrahmako sassamaṇabrāhmaṇī pajā sadevamanussā.
sn55.23:8.16.eng: The Buddha might take one side, and the Saṅgha of monks and the Saṅgha of nuns and the laymen and the laywomen and the world—with its gods, Māras, and divinities, this population with its ascetics and brahmins, gods and humans—the other.

sn55.23:8.18.pli: Evaṃ pasannaṃ maṃ, bhante, bhagavā dhāretū”ti.
sn55.23:8.18.eng: May the Buddha remember me as having such confidence.”

sn55.23:8.19.pli: “Evaṃvādī tvaṃ, godhe, mahānāmaṃ sakkaṃ kiṃ vadesī”ti?
sn55.23:8.19.eng: “Godhā, what do you have to say to Mahānāma when he speaks like this?”

sn55.23:8.20.pli: “Evaṃvādāhaṃ, bhante, mahānāmaṃ sakkaṃ na kiñci vadāmi, aññatra kalyāṇā aññatra kusalā”ti.
sn55.23:8.20.eng: “Sir, I have nothing to say to Mahānāma when he speaks like this, except what is good and wholesome.”

sn55.24:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena saraṇāni sakko kālaṅkato hoti.
sn55.24:1.2.eng: Now at that time Sarakāni the Sakyan had passed away.

sn55.24:1.3.eng: The Buddha declared that he was

sn55.24:1.4.eng: a stream-enterer, not liable to be reborn in the underworld, destined for awakening.

sn55.24:1.5.pli: Tatra sudaṃ sambahulā sakkā saṅgamma samāgamma ujjhāyanti khīyanti vipācenti:
sn55.24:1.5.eng: At that, several Sakyans came together complaining, grumbling, and objecting,

sn55.24:1.7.pli: Ettha dāni ko na sotāpanno bhavissati.
sn55.24:1.7.eng: Who can’t become a stream-enterer these days?

sn55.24:1.8.pli: Yatra hi nāma saraṇāni sakko kālaṅkato;
sn55.24:1.8.eng: For the Buddha even declared Sarakāni to be a stream-enterer after he passed away.

sn55.24:1.11.eng: Sarakāni was too weak for the training; he used to drink liquor.”

sn55.24:2.1.pli: Atha kho mahānāmo sakko yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi. Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho mahānāmo sakko bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
sn55.24:2.1.eng: Then Mahānāma the Sakyan went up to the Buddha, bowed, sat down to one side, and told him what had happened. The Buddha said:

sn55.24:2.5.pli: Tatra sudaṃ, bhante, sambahulā sakkā saṅgamma samāgamma ujjhāyanti khīyanti vipācenti—

sn55.24:2.6.pli: acchariyaṃ vata, bho, abbhutaṃ vata, bho.

sn55.24:2.7.pli: Ettha dāni ko na sotāpanno bhavissati.

sn55.24:2.8.pli: Yatra hi nāma saraṇāni sakko kālaṅkato;

sn55.24:3.1.pli: “Yo so, mahānāma, dīgharattaṃ upāsako buddhaṃ saraṇaṃ gato dhammaṃ saraṇaṃ gato saṅghaṃ saraṇaṃ gato, so kathaṃ vinipātaṃ gaccheyya.
sn55.24:3.1.eng: “Mahānāma, when a lay follower has for a long time gone for refuge to the Buddha, the teaching, and the Saṅgha, how could they go to the underworld?

sn55.24:3.2.pli: Yañhi taṃ, mahānāma, sammā vadamāno vadeyya:
sn55.24:3.2.eng: And if anyone should rightly be said to

sn55.24:3.3.pli: ‘dīgharattaṃ upāsako buddhaṃ saraṇaṃ gato dhammaṃ saraṇaṃ gato saṅghaṃ saraṇaṃ gato’ti, saraṇāni sakkaṃ sammā vadamāno vadeyya.
sn55.24:3.3.eng: have for a long time gone for refuge to the Buddha, the teaching, and the Saṅgha, it’s Sarakāni the Sakyan.

sn55.24:3.4.pli: Saraṇāni, mahānāma, sakko dīgharattaṃ upāsako buddhaṃ saraṇaṃ gato dhammaṃ saraṇaṃ gato saṅghaṃ saraṇaṃ gato.
sn55.24:3.4.eng: Sarakāni the Sakyan has for a long time gone for refuge to the Buddha, the teaching, and the Saṅgha.

sn55.24:3.5.eng: How could he go to the underworld?

sn55.24:4.1.pli: Idha, mahānāma, ekacco puggalo buddhe aveccappasādena samannāgato hoti—
sn55.24:4.1.eng: Take a certain individual who has experiential confidence in the Buddha …

sn55.24:4.2.pli: itipi so bhagavā …pe… satthā devamanussānaṃ buddho bhagavāti.

sn55.24:4.5.eng: They have laughing wisdom and swift wisdom, and are endowed with freedom.

sn55.24:4.6.pli: So āsavānaṃ khayā anāsavaṃ cetovimuttiṃ paññāvimuttiṃ diṭṭheva dhamme sayaṃ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharati.
sn55.24:4.6.eng: They’ve realized the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life. And they live having realized it with their own insight due to the ending of defilements.

sn55.24:4.7.pli: Ayampi kho, mahānāma, puggalo parimutto nirayā parimutto tiracchānayoniyā parimutto pettivisayā parimutto apāyaduggativinipātā.
sn55.24:4.7.eng: This individual is exempt from hell, the animal realm, and the ghost realm. They’re exempt from places of loss, bad places, the underworld.

sn55.24:5.1.pli: Idha pana, mahānāma, ekacco puggalo buddhe aveccappasādena samannāgato hoti—
sn55.24:5.1.eng: Take another individual who has experiential confidence in the Buddha …

sn55.24:5.2.pli: itipi so bhagavā …pe… satthā devamanussānaṃ buddho bhagavāti.

sn55.24:5.5.pli: hāsapañño javanapañño na ca vimuttiyā samannāgato.
sn55.24:5.5.eng: They have laughing wisdom and swift wisdom, but are not endowed with freedom.

sn55.24:5.6.pli: So pañcannaṃ orambhāgiyānaṃ saṃyojanānaṃ parikkhayā opapātiko hoti tattha parinibbāyī anāvattidhammo tasmā lokā.
sn55.24:5.6.eng: With the ending of the five lower fetters they’re reborn spontaneously. They are extinguished there, and are not liable to return from that world.

sn55.24:5.7.pli: Ayampi kho, mahānāma, puggalo parimutto nirayā parimutto tiracchānayoniyā parimutto pettivisayā parimutto apāyaduggativinipātā.
sn55.24:5.7.eng: This individual, too, is exempt from hell, the animal realm, and the ghost realm. They’re exempt from places of loss, bad places, the underworld.

sn55.24:6.1.pli: Idha pana, mahānāma, ekacco puggalo buddhe aveccappasādena samannāgato hoti—
sn55.24:6.1.eng: Take another individual who has experiential confidence in the Buddha …

sn55.24:6.2.pli: itipi so bhagavā …pe… satthā devamanussānaṃ buddho bhagavāti.

sn55.24:6.5.pli: na hāsapañño na javanapañño na ca vimuttiyā samannāgato.
sn55.24:6.5.eng: But they don’t have laughing wisdom or swift wisdom, nor are they endowed with freedom.

sn55.24:6.6.pli: So tiṇṇaṃ saṃyojanānaṃ parikkhayā rāgadosamohānaṃ tanuttā sakadāgāmī hoti, sakideva imaṃ lokaṃ āgantvā dukkhassantaṃ karoti.
sn55.24:6.6.eng: With the ending of three fetters, and the weakening of greed, hate, and delusion, they’re a once-returner. They come back to this world once only, then make an end of suffering.

sn55.24:6.7.pli: Ayampi kho, mahānāma, puggalo parimutto nirayā parimutto tiracchānayoniyā parimutto pettivisayā parimutto apāyaduggativinipātā.
sn55.24:6.7.eng: This individual, too, is exempt from hell, the animal realm, and the ghost realm. They’re exempt from places of loss, bad places, the underworld.

sn55.24:7.1.pli: Idha pana, mahānāma, ekacco puggalo buddhe aveccappasādena samannāgato hoti—
sn55.24:7.1.eng: Take another individual who has experiential confidence in the Buddha …

sn55.24:7.2.pli: itipi so bhagavā …pe… satthā devamanussānaṃ buddho bhagavāti;

sn55.24:7.5.pli: na hāsapañño na javanapañño na ca vimuttiyā samannāgato.
sn55.24:7.5.eng: But they don’t have laughing wisdom or swift wisdom, nor are they endowed with freedom.

sn55.24:7.6.pli: So tiṇṇaṃ saṃyojanānaṃ parikkhayā sotāpanno hoti avinipātadhammo niyato sambodhiparāyaṇoti.
sn55.24:7.6.eng: With the ending of three fetters they’re a stream-enterer, not liable to be reborn in the underworld, destined for awakening.

sn55.24:7.7.pli: Ayampi kho, mahānāma, puggalo parimutto nirayā parimutto tiracchānayoniyā parimutto pettivisayā parimutto apāyaduggativinipātā.
sn55.24:7.7.eng: This individual, too, is exempt from hell, the animal realm, and the ghost realm. They’re exempt from places of loss, bad places, the underworld.

sn55.24:8.1.pli: Idha pana, mahānāma, ekacco puggalo na heva kho buddhe aveccappasādena samannāgato hoti …
sn55.24:8.1.eng: Take another individual who doesn’t have experiential confidence in the Buddha …

sn55.24:8.4.pli: na hāsapañño na javanapañño na ca vimuttiyā samannāgato.
sn55.24:8.4.eng: They don’t have laughing wisdom or swift wisdom, nor are they endowed with freedom.

sn55.24:8.6.eng: the faculties of faith, energy, mindfulness, immersion, and wisdom.

sn55.24:8.7.pli: Tathāgatappaveditā cassa dhammā paññāya mattaso nijjhānaṃ khamanti.
sn55.24:8.7.eng: And they accept the teachings proclaimed by the Realized One after deliberating them with a degree of wisdom.

sn55.24:8.8.pli: Ayampi kho, mahānāma, puggalo agantā nirayaṃ agantā tiracchānayoniṃ agantā pettivisayaṃ agantā apāyaṃ duggatiṃ vinipātaṃ.
sn55.24:8.8.eng: This individual, too, doesn’t go to hell, the animal realm, and the ghost realm. They don’t go to places of loss, bad places, the underworld.

sn55.24:9.1.pli: Idha pana, mahānāma, ekacco puggalo na heva kho buddhe aveccappasādena samannāgato hoti …
sn55.24:9.1.eng: Take another individual who doesn’t have experiential confidence in the Buddha …

sn55.24:9.4.pli: na hāsapañño na javanapañño na ca vimuttiyā samannāgato,
sn55.24:9.4.eng: They don’t have laughing wisdom or swift wisdom, nor are they endowed with freedom.

sn55.24:9.6.eng: the faculties of faith, energy, mindfulness, immersion, and wisdom.

sn55.24:9.7.eng: And they have a degree of faith and love for the Buddha.

sn55.24:9.8.pli: Ayampi kho, mahānāma, puggalo agantā nirayaṃ agantā tiracchānayoniṃ agantā pettivisayaṃ agantā apāyaṃ duggatiṃ vinipātaṃ.
sn55.24:9.8.eng: This individual, too, doesn’t go to hell, the animal realm, and the ghost realm. They don’t go to places of loss, bad places, the underworld.

sn55.24:9.9.pli: Ime cepi, mahānāma, mahāsālā subhāsitaṃ dubbhāsitaṃ ājāneyyuṃ, ime cāhaṃ mahāsāle byākareyyaṃ: ‘sotāpannā avinipātadhammā niyatā sambodhiparāyaṇā’ti;
sn55.24:9.9.eng: If these great sal trees could understand what was well said and poorly said, I’d declare them to be stream-enterers.

sn55.24:9.10.eng: Why can’t this apply to Sarakāni?

sn55.24:9.11.pli: Saraṇāni, mahānāma, sakko maraṇakāle sikkhaṃ samādiyī”ti.
sn55.24:9.11.eng: Mahānāma, Sarakāni the Sakyan undertook the training at the time of his death.”

sn55.25:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena saraṇāni sakko kālaṅkato hoti.
sn55.25:1.2.eng: Now at that time Sarakāni the Sakyan had passed away.

sn55.25:1.3.eng: The Buddha declared that he was

sn55.25:1.4.eng: a stream-enterer, not liable to be reborn in the underworld, destined for awakening.

sn55.25:1.5.pli: Tatra sudaṃ sambahulā sakkā saṅgamma samāgamma ujjhāyanti khīyanti vipācenti:
sn55.25:1.5.eng: At that, several Sakyans came together complaining, grumbling, and objecting,

sn55.25:1.7.pli: Ettha dāni ko na sotāpanno bhavissati.
sn55.25:1.7.eng: Who can’t become a stream-enterer these days?

sn55.25:1.8.pli: Yatra hi nāma saraṇāni sakko kālaṅkato.
sn55.25:1.8.eng: For the Buddha even declared Sarakāni to be a stream-enterer after he passed away.

sn55.25:1.12.pli: Atha kho mahānāmo sakko yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi. Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho mahānāmo sakko bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
sn55.25:1.12.eng: Then Mahānāma the Sakyan went up to the Buddha, bowed, sat down to one side, and told him what had happened. The Buddha said:

sn55.25:2.4.pli: Tatra sudaṃ, bhante, sambahulā sakkā saṅgamma samāgamma ujjhāyanti khīyanti vipācenti:

sn55.25:2.6.pli: Ettha dāni ko na sotāpanno bhavissati.

sn55.25:2.7.pli: Yatra hi nāma saraṇāni sakko kālaṅkato.

sn55.25:3.1.pli: “Yo so, mahānāma, dīgharattaṃ upāsako buddhaṃ saraṇaṃ gato dhammaṃ saraṇaṃ gato saṅghaṃ saraṇaṃ gato, so kathaṃ vinipātaṃ gaccheyya.
sn55.25:3.1.eng: “Mahānāma, when a lay follower has for a long time gone for refuge to the Buddha, the teaching, and the Saṅgha, how could they go to the underworld?

sn55.25:3.2.pli: Yañhi taṃ, mahānāma, sammā vadamāno vadeyya:
sn55.25:3.2.eng: And if anyone should rightly be said to

sn55.25:3.3.pli: ‘dīgharattaṃ upāsako buddhaṃ saraṇaṃ gato dhammaṃ saraṇaṃ gato saṅghaṃ saraṇaṃ gato’, saraṇāniṃ sakkaṃ sammā vadamāno vadeyya.
sn55.25:3.3.eng: have for a long time gone for refuge to the Buddha, the teaching, and the Saṅgha, it’s Sarakāni the Sakyan.

sn55.25:3.4.pli: Saraṇāni, mahānāma, sakko dīgharattaṃ upāsako buddhaṃ saraṇaṃ gato dhammaṃ saraṇaṃ gato saṅghaṃ saraṇaṃ gato, so kathaṃ vinipātaṃ gaccheyya.
sn55.25:3.4.eng: Sarakāni the Sakyan has for a long time gone for refuge to the Buddha, the teaching, and the Saṅgha.

sn55.25:4.1.pli: Idha, mahānāma, ekacco puggalo buddhe ekantagato hoti abhippasanno—
sn55.25:4.1.eng: Take a certain individual who is sure and devoted to the Buddha …

sn55.25:4.2.pli: itipi so bhagavā …pe… satthā devamanussānaṃ buddho bhagavāti.

sn55.25:4.5.eng: They have laughing wisdom and swift wisdom, and are endowed with freedom.

sn55.25:4.6.pli: So āsavānaṃ khayā anāsavaṃ cetovimuttiṃ paññāvimuttiṃ diṭṭheva dhamme sayaṃ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharati.
sn55.25:4.6.eng: They realize the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life. And they live having realized it with their own insight due to the ending of defilements.

sn55.25:4.7.pli: Ayampi kho, mahānāma, puggalo parimutto nirayā parimutto tiracchānayoniyā parimutto pettivisayā parimutto apāyaduggativinipātā.
sn55.25:4.7.eng: This individual is exempt from hell, the animal realm, and the ghost realm. They’re exempt from places of loss, bad places, the underworld.

sn55.25:5.1.pli: Idha pana, mahānāma, ekacco puggalo buddhe ekantagato hoti abhippasanno—
sn55.25:5.1.eng: Take another individual who is sure and devoted to the Buddha …

sn55.25:5.2.pli: itipi so bhagavā …pe… satthā devamanussānaṃ buddho bhagavāti.

sn55.25:5.5.pli: hāsapañño javanapañño na ca vimuttiyā samannāgato.
sn55.25:5.5.eng: They have laughing wisdom and swift wisdom, but are not endowed with freedom.

sn55.25:5.6.pli: So pañcannaṃ orambhāgiyānaṃ saṃyojanānaṃ parikkhayā antarāparinibbāyī hoti, upahaccaparinibbāyī hoti, asaṅkhāraparinibbāyī hoti, sasaṅkhāraparinibbāyī hoti, uddhaṃsoto hoti akaniṭṭhagāmī.
sn55.25:5.6.eng: With the ending of the five lower fetters, they’re extinguished between one life and the next … they’re extinguished upon landing … they’re extinguished without extra effort … they’re extinguished with extra effort … they head upstream, going to the Akaniṭṭha realm.

sn55.25:5.7.pli: Ayampi kho, mahānāma, puggalo parimutto nirayā parimutto tiracchānayoniyā parimutto pettivisayā parimutto apāyaduggativinipātā.
sn55.25:5.7.eng: This individual, too, is exempt from hell, the animal realm, and the ghost realm. They’re exempt from places of loss, bad places, the underworld.

sn55.25:6.1.pli: Idha pana, mahānāma, ekacco puggalo buddhe ekantagato hoti abhippasanno—
sn55.25:6.1.eng: Take another individual who is sure and devoted to the Buddha …

sn55.25:6.2.pli: itipi so bhagavā …pe… satthā devamanussānaṃ buddho bhagavāti.

sn55.25:6.5.pli: na hāsapañño na javanapañño na ca vimuttiyā samannāgato.
sn55.25:6.5.eng: But they don’t have laughing wisdom or swift wisdom, nor are they endowed with freedom.

sn55.25:6.6.pli: So tiṇṇaṃ saṃyojanānaṃ parikkhayā rāgadosamohānaṃ tanuttā sakadāgāmī hoti, sakideva imaṃ lokaṃ āgantvā dukkhassantaṃ karoti.
sn55.25:6.6.eng: With the ending of three fetters, and the weakening of greed, hate, and delusion, they’re a once-returner. They come back to this world once only, then make an end of suffering.

sn55.25:6.7.pli: Ayampi kho, mahānāma, puggalo parimutto nirayā parimutto tiracchānayoniyā parimutto pettivisayā parimutto apāyaduggativinipātā.
sn55.25:6.7.eng: This individual, too, is exempt from hell, the animal realm, and the ghost realm. They’re exempt from places of loss, bad places, the underworld.

sn55.25:7.1.pli: Idha pana, mahānāma, ekacco puggalo buddhe ekantagato hoti abhippasanno—
sn55.25:7.1.eng: Take another individual who is sure and devoted to the Buddha …

sn55.25:7.2.pli: itipi so bhagavā …pe… satthā devamanussānaṃ buddho bhagavāti.

sn55.25:7.5.pli: na hāsapañño na javanapañño na ca vimuttiyā samannāgato.
sn55.25:7.5.eng: But they don’t have laughing wisdom or swift wisdom, nor are they endowed with freedom.

sn55.25:7.6.pli: So tiṇṇaṃ saṃyojanānaṃ parikkhayā sotāpanno hoti avinipātadhammo niyato sambodhiparāyaṇo.
sn55.25:7.6.eng: With the ending of three fetters they’re a stream-enterer, not liable to be reborn in the underworld, destined for awakening.

sn55.25:7.7.pli: Ayampi kho, mahānāma, puggalo parimutto nirayā parimutto tiracchānayoniyā parimutto pettivisayā parimutto apāyaduggativinipātā.
sn55.25:7.7.eng: This individual, too, is exempt from hell, the animal realm, and the ghost realm. They’re exempt from places of loss, bad places, the underworld.

sn55.25:8.1.pli: Idha pana, mahānāma, ekacco puggalo na heva kho buddhe ekantagato hoti abhippasanno …pe…
sn55.25:8.1.eng: Take another individual who isn’t sure or devoted to the Buddha …

sn55.25:8.4.pli: na hāsapañño na javanapañño na ca vimuttiyā samannāgato;
sn55.25:8.4.eng: They don’t have laughing wisdom or swift wisdom, nor are they endowed with freedom.

sn55.25:8.6.eng: the faculties of faith, energy, mindfulness, immersion, and wisdom.

sn55.25:8.7.pli: Tathāgatappaveditā cassa dhammā paññāya mattaso nijjhānaṃ khamanti.
sn55.25:8.7.eng: And they accept the teachings proclaimed by the Realized One after deliberating them with a degree of wisdom.

sn55.25:8.8.pli: Ayampi kho, mahānāma, puggalo agantā nirayaṃ agantā tiracchānayoniṃ agantā pettivisayaṃ agantā apāyaṃ duggatiṃ vinipātaṃ.
sn55.25:8.8.eng: This individual, too, doesn’t go to hell, the animal realm, and the ghost realm. They don’t go to places of loss, bad places, the underworld.

sn55.25:9.1.pli: Idha pana, mahānāma, ekacco puggalo na heva kho buddhe ekantagato hoti abhippasanno …
sn55.25:9.1.eng: Take another individual who isn’t sure or devoted to the Buddha …

sn55.25:9.4.pli: na hāsapañño na javanapañño na ca vimuttiyā samannāgato;
sn55.25:9.4.eng: They don’t have laughing wisdom or swift wisdom, nor are they endowed with freedom.

sn55.25:9.6.eng: the faculties of faith, energy, mindfulness, immersion, and wisdom.

sn55.25:9.7.eng: And they have a degree of faith and love for the Buddha.

sn55.25:9.8.pli: Ayampi kho, mahānāma, puggalo agantā nirayaṃ agantā tiracchānayoniṃ agantā pettivisayaṃ agantā apāyaṃ duggatiṃ vinipātaṃ.
sn55.25:9.8.eng: This individual, too, doesn’t go to hell, the animal realm, and the ghost realm. They don’t go to places of loss, bad places, the underworld.

sn55.25:10.1.pli: Seyyathāpi, mahānāma, dukkhettaṃ dubbhūmaṃ avihatakhāṇukaṃ, bījāni cassu khaṇḍāni pūtīni vātātapahatāni asārādāni asukhasayitāni, devo ca na sammā dhāraṃ anuppaveccheyya.
sn55.25:10.1.eng: Suppose there was a barren field, a barren ground, with uncleared stumps. And you had seeds that were broken, spoiled, weather-damaged, infertile, and ill kept. And the heavens didn’t provide enough rain.

sn55.25:10.2.pli: Api nu tāni bījāni vuddhiṃ virūḷhiṃ vepullaṃ āpajjeyyun”ti?
sn55.25:10.2.eng: Would those seeds grow, increase, and mature?”

sn55.25:10.4.pli: “Evameva kho, mahānāma, idha dhammo durakkhāto hoti duppavedito aniyyāniko anupasamasaṃvattaniko asammāsambuddhappavedito—
sn55.25:10.4.eng: “In the same way, take a teaching that’s badly explained and badly propounded, not emancipating, not leading to peace, proclaimed by someone who is not a fully awakened Buddha.

sn55.25:10.5.eng: This is what I call a barren field.

sn55.25:10.6.pli: Tasmiñca dhamme sāvako viharati dhammānudhammappaṭipanno sāmīcippaṭipanno anudhammacārī—
sn55.25:10.6.eng: A disciple remains in such a teaching, practicing in line with that teaching, practicing it properly, living in line with that teaching.

sn55.25:10.7.eng: This is what I call a bad seed.

sn55.25:11.1.pli: Seyyathāpi, mahānāma, sukhettaṃ subhūmaṃ suvihatakhāṇukaṃ, bījāni cassu akhaṇḍāni apūtīni avātātapahatāni sārādāni sukhasayitāni;
sn55.25:11.1.eng: Suppose there was a fertile field, a fertile ground, well-cleared of stumps. And you had seeds that were intact, unspoiled, not weather-damaged, fertile, and well-kept. And there’s plenty of rainfall.

sn55.25:11.3.pli: Api nu tāni bījāni vuddhiṃ virūḷhiṃ vepullaṃ āpajjeyyun”ti?
sn55.25:11.3.eng: Would those seeds grow, increase, and mature?”

sn55.25:11.5.pli: “Evameva kho, mahānāma, idha dhammo svākkhāto hoti suppavedito niyyāniko upasamasaṃvattaniko sammāsambuddhappavedito—
sn55.25:11.5.eng: “In the same way, take a teaching that’s well explained and well propounded, emancipating, leading to peace, proclaimed by someone who is a fully awakened Buddha.

sn55.25:11.6.eng: This is what I call a fertile field.

sn55.25:11.7.pli: Tasmiñca dhamme sāvako viharati dhammānudhammappaṭipanno sāmīcippaṭipanno anudhammacārī—
sn55.25:11.7.eng: A disciple remains in such a teaching, practicing in line with that teaching, practicing it properly, living in line with that teaching.

sn55.25:11.8.eng: This is what I call a good seed.

sn55.25:11.9.eng: Why can’t this apply to Sarakāni?

sn55.25:11.10.pli: Saraṇāni, mahānāma, sakko maraṇakāle sikkhāya paripūrakārī ahosī”ti.
sn55.25:11.10.eng: Mahānāma, Sarakāni the Sakyan fulfilled the training at the time of his death.”
